PaperTitle: Bird's-Eye - Large-Scale Visual Analytics of City Dynamics using Social Location Data

GranularBlocks.PaperDescription: Records social location data from Foursquare, including venues and check-in data, storing them with spatial and temporal metadata.
Outputs: Venue records with check-in frequencies and categories
City stats documents with timestamps and user check-in lists
GranularBlocks.ReferenceCitation: Section 4.1 Scalable Data Monitoring Back-end: From Foursquare's API we collect information about venues (places) and consecutive checked-in users.

GranularBlocks.PaperDescription: Collects Twitter messages associated with Foursquare check-ins to infer user movement transitions between locations.
Inputs: Twitter Streaming API data linked with Foursquare check-ins
Outputs: Transition data with user movement patterns and place connections
GranularBlocks.ReferenceCitation: Section 4.1 Scalable Data Monitoring Back-end: Because many users have linked their Foursquare account with their Twitter account, we overcome this issue by collecting Foursquare-related messages from the Twitter Streaming API.

GranularBlocks.PaperDescription: Implements hierarchical pre-aggregation of check-in data into hourly, daily, and monthly chunks to enable fast querying for visual exploration.
Inputs: Raw check-in data from city stats collection
Outputs: Pre-aggregated check-in counts by venue and time period
GranularBlocks.ReferenceCitation: Section 4.1 Aggregation and Retrieval: Drawing on ideas from recent research, we developed a hierarchical pre-aggregation scheme to accelerate queries.

GranularBlocks.PaperDescription: Performs DBSCAN clustering to detect spatial clusters of venues, representing functional city zones such as shopping areas or food districts.
Outputs: Clusters of venues representing functional geographic zones
GranularBlocks.ReferenceCitation: Section 4.3.2 Cluster-based Activity Aggregation: First, we run DBSCAN clustering to find groups of spatially related venues (visited places) that match the natural breaks in the geographic distribution.

GranularBlocks.PaperDescription: Applies a custom kernel density estimation algorithm on venues to compute smoothed density values that inform the heatmap visualization of activity hotspots.
Outputs: Density values per venue for heatmap visualization
GranularBlocks.ReferenceCitation: Section 4.3.1 Check-in-based Kernel Density Estimation: Bird's-Eye offers a heatmap that renders the general spatial distribution and corresponding check-in densities using a kernel-density-based splatting algorithm.

GranularBlocks.PaperDescription: Detects spatial and temporal outliers by identifying check-in counts that deviate from the mean by a user-defined number of standard deviations.
Outputs: Anomalous places and time periods flagged as outliers
GranularBlocks.ReferenceCitation: Section 4.3.3 Adaptive Outlier Detection: Our outlier detection method finds unusually high or low numbers of check-ins for top-level venue categories that deviate from the usual.

GranularBlocks.PaperDescription: Displays an interactive 2D geographic map showing venues and clusters, with support for zooming and category-based filtering.
GranularBlocks.ReferenceCitation: Section 4.2 Interactive Visual Analytics Interface: The interactive map enables geographic analysis. It can be zoomed in and out and explored like in typical web-based GIS systems.

GranularBlocks.PaperDescription: Renders a heatmap overlay on the map, showing spatial distributions of check-in activity with color gradients representing density levels.
Outputs: Color-encoded heatmap layer on the map
GranularBlocks.ReferenceCitation: Section 4.3.1 Check-in-based Kernel Density Estimation: Bird's-Eye offers a heatmap that renders the general spatial distribution and corresponding check-in densities using a kernel-density-based splatting algorithm.

GranularBlocks.PaperDescription: Displays concave hull polygons on the map, enclosing clustered areas and color-coded by dominant venue category to show functional zones.
Outputs: Overlay of functional zones on the 2D map
GranularBlocks.ReferenceCitation: Section 4.3.2 Cluster-based Activity Aggregation: To visually indicate the DBSCAN clusters, we determine their concave hulls using an algorithm by Emil Ros√©n et al.

GranularBlocks.PaperDescription: Displays aggregated mobility patterns between clusters as a node-link diagram on the map, with link thickness representing movement volume.
Outputs: Node-link diagram of mobility flows overlaid on the map
GranularBlocks.ReferenceCitation: Section 4.4 Features for Mobility Analysis: To reveal geographic mobility patterns we overlay our map with a node-link diagram.

GranularBlocks.PaperDescription: Displays the temporal distribution of check-ins across categories as a stacked area chart, allowing for temporal filtering and selection.
Inputs: Pre-aggregated check-in data by category and time
Outputs: Time series visualization of check-in activity by category
GranularBlocks.ReferenceCitation: Section 4.2 Interactive Visual Analytics Interface: The temporal distribution of check-ins by category can be visualized in a stacked area chart.

GranularBlocks.PaperDescription: Shows transitions of users between different venue categories over time, enabling the exploration of temporal mobility flows.
Inputs: Pre-aggregated transition data between categories over time
Outputs: Alluvial diagram showing temporal category transitions
GranularBlocks.ReferenceCitation: Section 4.4 Features for Mobility Analysis: To explore temporal transitions of Foursquare users between categories in time, the stacked area chart can be changed to an alluvial diagram.

GranularBlocks.PaperDescription: Displays hourly or weekly patterns of check-in counts for a selected cluster as a radial area chart, helping to compare temporal activity trends across clusters.
Inputs: Clustered venue check-in data over time
Outputs: Radial chart of temporal patterns per cluster
GranularBlocks.ReferenceCitation: Section 4.3.2 Cluster-based Activity Aggregation: Clicking on the clusters reveals a radial area chart that shows check-in category activities over time for the venues in this cluster.

GranularBlocks.PaperDescription: Enables users to interactively select time ranges in the stacked area chart to update the spatial map and mobility visualizations accordingly.
Inputs: User-selected time range from stacked area chart
Outputs: Filtered check-in and mobility data for the selected time range
GranularBlocks.ReferenceCitation: Section 4.2 Interactive Visual Analytics Interface: The user can select a sub-range of the loaded time span to drill-down. Each action synchronizes the visualizations in the map.

GranularBlocks.PaperDescription: Allows users to enable or disable specific venue categories in both the stacked area chart and the map, refining the focus of the analysis.
Inputs: User-selected categories from category list panel
Outputs: Filtered venue data and visual updates in map and timeline
GranularBlocks.ReferenceCitation: Section 4.2 Interactive Visual Analytics Interface: A color-coded list of the Foursquare top-level categories serves as a legend and can also be used to filter the data by categories.
